result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry R Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 27 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Woodman's in Menomonee Falls (case 15CM414) to be paid as a condition of probation.
Court waives court costs and DNA Surcharge.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Court waives DNA Specimen.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jerry R Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Cases 14CF1022 and 15CM414 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 2 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 3 months, Extended Supervision:  year 3 months).  Credit for 27 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution of $155.98(from case 15CM414) to be paid to Woodmans of Menomonee Falls as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
